newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Britain repeats objection to veto loss.
newsitem.headline: Britain repeats objection to veto loss.

text.p: Britain responded to a European Union request to outline its position on EU decision-making by reiterating that it was determined to retain its veto, a British diplomat said on Thursday.
The diplomat said London had sent letter to the Irish EU presidency outlining its objections to any moves towards majority voting on EU matters. "Our position is quite clear," the diplomat said.

Ireland, which is chairing negotiations on a new EU treaty, asked members last week to complete a form outlining the circumstances under which they would be willing to give up unanimity in favour of majority voting.
Britain has said it wants no further move in that direction.
The diplomat said he did not know how many other countries had filled out the questionnaire but some had initially seemed reluctant. "There has been quite a lot of sucking of teeth," he said.
